TECHNICALDETAILS.free_text: Peroxisomes are contrasted with DAB at pH 10.5 by their catalase activity, after fixation in buffered formal-calcium; post-fixed in OSO4

IMAGEDESCRIPTION.free_text: Many oval peroxisomes can be seen in normal cytotrophoblast cells of first trimester chorionic villus.  The cytotrophoblast also contains glycogen particles, isolated and in flakes, which distinguish these cells from the syncytiotrophoblast (at left in this image). Bars = 1 µm (low magnification), 0.1 µm (high magnification). In some genetic diseases (Zellweger, Infantile Refsum) peroxisomes are absent; this can be diagnosed in chorionic villi.

PUBLISHED: "Peroxisomes. A personal account". pp. 151. Copyright VUB-Press 1991.
